ActAeronautics Act
Secure Air Travel Act
SubjectRegulations Amending the Secure Air Travel Regulations and the Designated Provisions Regulations
PrecisRegulations Amending the SECURE AIR TRAVEL REGULATIONS AND THE DESIGNATED PROVISIONS REGULATIONS in order to (1) clarify that air carriers must offer travellers an opportunity to provide their Canadian Travel Number (CTN) when reserving flights and at check-in; (2) clarify that the Minister has authority to collect passenger information for passenger-carrying flights that are exempted under the Secure Air Travel Regulations but voluntarily provided by air carriers for the purpose of the Passenger Protect Program; (3) remove the requirement for air carriers to provide passenger information at check-in, if there is no change to the information already provided at 72 hours before departure; (4) require air carriers to only communicate with Transport Canada Passenger Protect Program Operations Centre during an outage when there are changes in passenger information that are consequential for passenger screening against the Secure Air Travel Act (SATA) List and that involve significant discrepancies; (5) extend the deadline for the destruction of the SATA List by four months to provide extra time for air carriers; and (6) allow the Minister of Transport to maintain the authority to issue administrative monetary penalties to air carriers who fail to meet the requirements associated with the collection of CTNs.
